desc: The CYSLTR2 gene encodes the cysteinyl leukotriene receptor 2, a member of the G protein-coupled receptor family. CYSLTR2 is one of the receptors activated by Cysteinyl leukotrienes (CysLTs), which are inflammatory lipid mediators synthesized by a variety of cells and involved in allergic processes (PMID: 16776669, 13679572). CYSLTR2 modulates endothelial permeability and signals through the calcium/PKC pathway (PMID: 15545522, 25839425). CYSLTR2 might play a role in colon cancer (PMID: 21203429, 23829413). CYSLTR2 is rarely mutated in cancers, but it is deleted in a subset of prostate carcinomas (cBioPortal, MSKCC, Dec. 2016).
